alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Northern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 4:58PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Worcester, southeastern Hampshire, southeastern Franklin and central Hampden Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chicopee, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain with localized flooding, winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Chicopee, Holyoke, Amherst, Agawam, West Springfield, Ludlow, South Hadley, East Longmeadow, Belchertown, Wilbraham, Palmer, Ware, Granby, Hadley, Hardwick, Shutesbury, Pelham, Petersham and New Braintree. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
